instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A one bip
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't boot. 

I get one beep, but no boot. It just givges one beep continuously in 5 seconds interval each.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A one bip
threads.message:
RAM, or CPU problem.
No worth to spend time on it.
